stimulusHtml:
Read each part carefully. Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

Students are to perform an experiment to determine the acceleration due to gravity, g, in the lab using the setup shown, where the wheel rolls down the incline without slipping. They are expected to find g by plotting their data in a graph. The students have access to equipment commonly found in a high school physics laboratory, but the experiment must use the setup as shown above, which includes a wheel with mass M and radius R, and an inclined plane that makes an angle of Î¸ degrees with the horizontal. Students model the wheel as a ring with rotational inertia I=Mr2 .

(a) Briefly identify each quantity to be measured, the symbol used to represent that quantity, and the equipment that would be used to measure the quantity to be able to determine the acceleration due to gravity, g.

(b) Briefly describe the procedure to be used to determine the acceleration due to gravity, g. Provide enough detail so that another student could replicate the experiment, including any steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty. As needed, use the symbols defined in part (a) above.

(c) Which quantities (raw data or calculated from the data) would be graphed on the vertical and horizontal axes to produce a graph that could be used to determine the acceleration due to gravity, g ?
(d) Describe which information from the graph described in part (c) would be used and how that information would be used to determine the acceleration due to gravity, g.
(e) The students determine from their data that the magnitude of g is noticeably larger than its accepted value. Identify one physical reason for this experimental difference.
